title: Umbilical Termination and Moulding
purpose: Terminate and mould a steel armoured ROV umbilical using a termination socket.
Verify mechanical integrity through load testing before returning to service.
safety: Only trained and competent personnel may perform or supervise this procedure.
Ensure all electrical systems are isolated, locked out, and proven dead.
Establish exclusion zones during cutting and load testing.
Never place fingers through UTS eyes; use slings or rope at all times.
tools: Load cell or approved test weights

steps.title: Preparation
text: Confirm weather and vessel movements are suitable for the operation.
Ensure permits to work are in place and a toolbox talk has been completed.
Check moulding compound expiry date.
Isolate electrical supplies, prove dead, and lock off systems.

steps.title: System shutdown and isolation
text: Shut down and ground the ROV system.
Pay out the required length of umbilical from the winch.
Power off the winch and/or A-frame.
Post work-in-progress signage and verify complete isolation.

steps.title: Disconnect and cut back
text: Secure the umbilical to prevent movement before cutting.
Disconnect the termination socket from the TMS or vehicle using slings or rope.
Apply secure bindings either side of the cut location.
Cut the umbilical at the required length.
Remove the old cast from the termination socket.

steps.title: Prepare termination socket and strands
text: Thoroughly clean and degrease the inside of the termination socket.
Inspect the socket for damage.
Apply a tight binding-wire serving approximately 45 mm long to the umbilical before cutting the strands.
End the binding wire where the bullet entry will sit when the termination socket is in its final position.
notes: Correct placement of the binding wire helps prevent bird-caging and maintains correct strand lay.

steps.title: Cut and prepare strands
text: Cut the armour strands to match the cone shape of the termination socket.
Slightly spread the strands to allow access for cleaning.
Thoroughly clean and degrease all strands.
Pull the termination socket over the strands.
Ensure strands sit 2â€“5 mm below the edge of the cone.
Confirm strands are evenly distributed and the umbilical is straight and level.

steps.title: Moulding
text: Mix the moulding compound according to the manufacturer's instructions.
Do not heat the termination socket or umbilical.
Pour the compound slowly and continuously against the inner wall of the socket.
Fill to the edge of the cone without overfilling or underfilling.
Seal any leakage at the umbilical entry with grease tape if required.
Allow the mould to cure as specified by the compound manufacturer.

steps.title: Load test
text: Conduct a task-specific safety briefing before load testing.
Establish an exclusion zone around the test area.
Apply a test load equal to 125% of the system safe working load.
Hold the test load for a minimum of five minutes.
Use soft slings or approved adapters; do not connect rigging directly to the termination socket bolt.

steps.title: Inspection and completion
text: Inspect the moulded termination for cracks, deformation, or signs of separation.
Report and document any defects immediately.
Remove or discard any rigging loaded beyond its rated capacity.

notes: The moulding and termination process must always follow the moulding compound manufacturer's instructions.
Correct strand preparation and cleanliness are critical for long-term termination integrity.
